items.title: Concerns Grow About ‘Severely Polluted’ Water in China’s Cities
items.abstract: China’s other major pollution problem — degradation of its water supply — is drawing increasing attention from environmentalists, and investors.

items.title: Dreaming of the California Design Scene
items.abstract: "A Handbook of California Design," a new book edited by Bobbye Tigerman, is an incisive history of a design scene from the Depression to 1965.

items.title: Coal Mine Fight Embodies an Economic Struggle in Rural Australia
items.abstract: An appeals court ruling could set a precedent that favors the environmental interests of local communities over the economic interests of mining companies.

items.title: Solving the Problems of Rural America
items.abstract: Readers react to Paul Krugman’s statement that “nobody knows how to reverse” the economic decline of the heartland.

items.title: San Francisco’s Homeless Population Is Much Bigger Than Thought, City Data Suggests
items.abstract: Tuesday: Data kept by the city reveals a more alarming portrait than a point-in-time count. Also: The streaming era has arrived.

items.title: Coming This Season: Pep Guardiola 3.0
items.abstract: Manchester City will begin defense of its Premier League title with a team that doesn’t (exactly) look like its predecessors. That isn’t necessarily a bad thing.
